thread.title: Audit office highly critical of government funding for WestConnex
thread.title_full: Audit office highly critical of government funding for WestConnex

author: Matt O'Sullivan
title: Audit office highly critical of government funding for WestConnex
text:
'My house is totally gone' 'My house is totally gone' 
Homeowner Warren Jarvis has lost property and animals to a large fire impacting the township of Cassilis in central west NSW. More videos Home owner arrested during WestConnex eviction 
A Sydney man is arrested while attempting to prevent the compulsory acquisition of his home for the WestConnex motorway. 
In a report critical of the Coalition government's funding of the $16.8 billion motorway, Commonwealth Auditor-General Grant Hehir also found that upfront payments and adjusting milestones for later payments "did not adequately protect the Australian government's financial interests". 
His report, released on Tuesday, was particularly scathing of funds being paid in advance of the project's needs. Related Content 'Stop the secrecy': WestConnex's $5.15m executives' salary bill 
Advice provided before a $500 million injection of funds in 2014 "identified that a payment of that magnitude was not yet required", it said. 
The $500 million was part of $1.5 billion in direct funding from the federal government for the 33-kilometre motorway. Advertisement 
The Audit Office has calculated that the cost of the funds provided before they were actually required has amounted to about $20 million since 2014. 
The report said a decision in May 2014 to pay the $500 million in advance led to the motorway project being approved without "any documented analysis and advice to ministers that the statutory criteria for giving such approvals has been met". SHARE
